action.action-desc: Mr. Portman introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

form.official-title: To clarify that nonprofit organizations such as Habitat for Humanity can accept donated mortgage appraisals, and for other purposes.

section.header: Exemption from Truth in Lending Act
section.text: Section 129E(i)(2) of the Truth in Lending Act is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) and (B) as clauses (i) and (ii), respectively;
by striking For purposes of and inserting (A) In general.—For purposes of; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Rule of construction related to appraisal donations
subparagraph.text: In the case of an appraisal for which the appraiser voluntarily does not receive a fee, the appraiser is not, and shall not be construed to be, with respect to the donated appraisal, a fee appraiser for purposes of this section.
